contentrichtext.text: {{lunar crater data| latitude=31.8| N_or_S=N| longitude=51.8| E_or_W=W| diameter=10 km| depth=''Unknown''| colong=52| eponym=[[Axel Nielsen|Axel V. Nielsen]]<br />[[Harald Herborg Nielsen|Harald H. Nielsen]]}} '''Nielsen''' is a lunar [[impact crater]] on the [[Oceanus Procellarum]]. It is located north-east of [[Montes Agricola]] on the western hemisphere of the Moon. To the east-southeast is the crater [[Wollaston (crater)|Wollaston]]. Nielsen is a bowl-shaped formation that lies astride a small ridge that runs north-northwestwards towards the [[Mons Rümker]]. The latter is an unusual raised formation of [[lunar dome]]s. The crater is named jointly after the Danish astronomer [[Axel Nielsen]] (1902-1970) and the Danish–American physicist [[Harald Herborg Nielsen]] (1903-1973). ==References== {{Lunar crater references}} ==External links== *{{cite web | last=Wood | first=Charles A. | date=September 8, 2004 | url=http://www.lpod.org/archive/LPOD-2004-09-08.htm | title=Where in the Moon is Nielsen? | publisher=Lunar Picture of the Day | accessdate=2007-09-05 }} *{{cite web | author=Staff | year=2007 | url=http://www.lpi.usra.edu/resources/mapcatalog/LTO/lto38b2_4/ | title=LTO-38B2: Nielsen | publisher=Lunar & Planetary Institute | accessdate=2007-09-05 }} http://www.lunarrepublic.com/atlas/sections/c2.shtml {{Moon-crater-stub}} [[Category:Impact craters on the Moon]]
